lines.text:
[with wine bottle]
Shall I pour it sir?

[sarcastically]
What do you expect it to... sweat itself out?

[as Diane is leaving in a huff]
Goodbye, Diane. Forget me and marry a Sagitarius.

[angrily as he is leaving too through the door]
She's gonna marry an American like her mother did!
Are you going to marry my daughter?
Why we can't marry while Uranus faces Jupiter>

[exasperated]
Ih, we're gonna start that again? Hunh?
As a matter of fact, we shouldn't get narried at all.

[trying to explain]
Well, you see, she's earth, and I'm water. You mix the two and you get mud. What could we expect our children to be?
Every time I try to make a date, one of your planets gets a stomach ache. I'm sick of it.

[noticing his black eye]
Why, what happened to your eye?
Where have I seen you before?
Well, I was at the army and navy game.
